schemas.name: comorbidity
schemas.description: Any medical conditions (e.g diabetes, prior cancer malignancies) that have existed or may occur during the clinical course of the participant who has the index disease under study.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant within the study, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: age_at_comorbidity_diagnosis
fields.description: Indicate the age (in days) of comorbidity diagnosis.

required: Provide code in Compact URI (CURIE) pattern. ICD-10 code: refer to https://icd.who.int/browse10/2019/en MONDO code: refer to https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/mondo

fields.name: comorbidity_code
fields.description: Use ICD-10 code or Mondo code to indicate the comorbidity diagnosed. Provide code in Compact URI (CURIE) pattern.

fields.name: comorbidity_status
fields.description: Indicate the current state or activity of the comorbid condition.

fields.name: comorbidity_term
fields.description: Provide the standardized and human readable term derived from the coding system associated with the comorbidity_code

fields.name: comorbidity_treatment_status
fields.description: Indicate whether the comorbid condition is currently being treated or not.

schemas.name: demographic
schemas.description: Data for the characterization of the participant by means of segmenting the population (e.g., characterization by age, sex, or race).

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant within the study, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: age_at_death
fields.description: Age of participant (in days) at time of death

fields.name: age_at_enrollment
fields.description: Age (in days) of participant at time of enrollment into the study

fields.name: cause_of_death
fields.description: Indicate the cause of a participant's death.

fields.name: vital_status
fields.description: Participant's last known state of living or deceased.

fields.name: country_of_birth
fields.description: The country where an individual was born, typically defined by current geopolitical borders.

fields.name: ancestry
fields.description: The genetic or genomic heritage of an individual, typically tracing the origins of one's ancestors.

fields.name: height
fields.description: The measurement of an individual from head to toe recorded in centimeters (cm).

fields.name: weight
fields.description: The mass or body weight of an individual measured in kilograms (kg).

fields.name: highest_education_level_achieved
fields.description: The highest level of formal education an individual has completed.

fields.name: employment
fields.description: The current work status of an individual.

fields.name: type_of_residence
fields.description: The kind of dwelling in which an individual lives.

fields.name: number_of_other_people_in_household
fields.description: The total number of individuals living in the same household as the participant, excluding the participant.

fields.name: pregnancy
fields.description: Indicates whether an individual is currently pregnant.

schemas.name: diagnosis
schemas.description: The disease that is inferred to be present in the individual, family or cohort being analyzed.

fields.name: submitter_diagnosis_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the primary diagnosis event, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant within the study, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: age_at_diagnosis
fields.description: Age of participant (in days) at time of diagnosis of the condition.

required: Provide code in Compact URI (CURIE) pattern. ICD-10 code: refer to https://icd.who.int/browse10/2019/en MONDO code: refer to https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/mondo

fields.name: disease_code
fields.description: Use ICD-10 code or Mondo code to represent the disease diagnosed.

fields.name: disease_term
fields.description: Provide the standardized and human readable term derived from the coding system associated with the disease_code

fields.name: covid19_severity
fields.description: A measure of the severity of a COVID-19 infection, which can range from mild to severe or critical.

codeList: Ambulatory (with or without limitation of activities)
Hospitalized - mild disease (hospitalized, no oxygen therapy)
Hospitalized - mild disease (hospitalized, oxygen by mask or nasal prongs)
Hospitalized - severe disease (intubation and mechanical ventilation)
Hospitalized - severe disease (non-invasive ventilation or high-flow oxygen)
Hospitalized - severe disease (ventilation and additional organ support, i.e. pressors, RRT, ECMO)
Uninfected (no clinical or virological evidence of infection)

fields.name: covid19_vaccine_doses
fields.description: The number of COVID-19 vaccine doses the patient has received.

schemas.name: exposure
schemas.description: Capture information about external factors, agents, or conditions an individual has encountered that may influence health or disease outcomes.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant within the study, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: age_at_exposure
fields.description: Age (in days) when the participant was exposed (or first exposed)

fields.name: exposure_amount
fields.description: Provide intensity, quantity or frequency of the exposure

fields.name: exposure_code
fields.description:
Provide the standardized codes from SNOMED CT, ExO, LOINC to represent the type of exposure.
Provide code in Compact URI (CURIE) pattern.

fields.name: exposure_duration
fields.description: Duration of exposure period

fields.name: exposure_status
fields.description: Provide the status of the exposure

fields.name: exposure_term
fields.description: Provide the standardized and human readable term derived from the coding system associated with the exposure_code

fields.name: exposure_unit
fields.description: Unit associated with exposure_amount

schemas.name: follow_up
schemas.description: Any point of contact with a patient after primary diagnosis.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant within the study, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: age_at_followup
fields.description: Participant's age (in days) at time of the follow up event

fields.name: disease_status_at_followup
fields.description: Indicate the participant's disease status at time of follow-up

schemas.name: measurement
schemas.description: Record individual measurements to capture quantitative, ordinal (e.g., absent/present), or categorical measurements.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant within the study, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: age_at_measurement
fields.description: Age (in days) of the participant at the time the lab test or measurement was conducted.

required: Provide code in Compact URI (CURIE) pattern. LOINC URL: https://loinc.org/{code}

fields.name: measurement_code
fields.description: Use standartized LOINC (Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes) code to represent quantitative, ordinal, or categorical measurements.

fields.name: measurement_result_categorical
fields.description: The categorical result of the lab test or measurement.

fields.name: measurement_result_numeric
fields.description: The numeric result of the lab test or measurement.

fields.name: measurement_term
fields.description: Provide the standardized and human readable term derived from the coding system associated with the measurement_code

fields.name: measurement_unit
fields.description: Indicate the unit of measurement for the result using LOINC code.

schemas.name: medication
schemas.description: An agent such as a drug (pharmaceutical agent), broadly defined as prescription and over-the-counter medicines, vaccines, and large-molecule biologic therapies.

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the treatment, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: actual_cumulative_drug_dose
fields.description: Indicate the total actual cumulative drug dose in the same units specified in drug_dose_units.

required: Provide code in Compact URI (CURIE) pattern.  RxNorm URL: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui/{code}  KEGG URL: https://www.kegg.jp/entry/{code}  PubChem URL: https://pubchem.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/compound/{code}  NCIt URL: https://ncit.nci.nih.gov/ncitbrowser/ConceptReport.jsp?dictionary=NCI_Thesaurus&code=C{code}

fields.name: drug_code
fields.description: Provide the standardized code from RxNorm, KEGG,  PubChem or NCIt to represent the drug.

fields.name: drug_dose_units
fields.description: Indicate units used to record drug dose.

fields.name: drug_term
fields.description: Provide the standardized and human readable term derived from the coding system associated with the drug_code

fields.name: prescribed_cumulative_drug_dose
fields.description: Indicate the total prescribed cumulative drug dose in the same units specified in drug_dose_units.

schemas.name: participant
schemas.description: The collection of all data related to a specific individual human in the context of a specific study.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant within the study, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: disease_specific_modifier
fields.description: If the permission is DUO:0000007 (disease specific research), then MONDO codes must be provided to specify which disease(s) apply.

fields.name: duo_modifier
fields.description: Collection of Data Use Ontology (DUO) codes in Compact URI (CURIE) pattern to add requirements, limitations, or prohibitions within the permitted boundary for the Participant data.

codeList: DUO:0000018 (not for profit, non commercial use only)
DUO:0000045 (not for profit organisation use only)
DUO:00000044 (population origins or ancestry research prohibited)

fields.name: duo_permission
fields.description: Select one of the Data Use Ontology (DUO) codes in Compact URI (CURIE) pattern to indicate permitted uses or focused areas of research for the Participant data.

codeList: DUO:0000006 (health or medical or biomedical research)
DUO:0000011 (population origins or ancestry research only)

schemas.name: phenotype
schemas.description: Individual phenotypic features, observed as either present or absent (excluded), with possible onset, modifiers and frequency

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant within the study, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: age_at_phenotype
fields.description: Participant's age (in days) when phenotype was observed

required: Provide code in Compact URI (CURIE) pattern.  HPO URL: https://hpo.jax.org/app/browse/term/HP:<code>

fields.name: phenotype_code
fields.description: Use standardized HPO (Human Phenotype Ontology) codes to represent the phenotype.

fields.name: phenotype_duration
fields.description: Indicate the length of time (in days) over which the phenotype was observed in the participant.

fields.name: phenotype_observed
fields.description: Indicate whether the phenotype was observed in the participant.

fields.name: phenotype_severity
fields.description: The degree or severity of the observed phenotype.

fields.name: phenotype_term
fields.description: Provide the standardized and human readable term derived from the coding system associated with the phenotype_code.

schemas.name: procedure
schemas.description: A clinical procedure performed on a subject. For example a surgical or diagnostic procedure such as a biopsy.

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the treatment, assigned by the data provider.

required: Refer to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3) manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344

fields.name: procedure_body_site_code
fields.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code to describe the site of the surgery if applicable. Please use C80.9 if the site is Unkown.

fields.name: procedure_body_site_term
fields.description: Provide the standardized and human readable term derived from the coding system associated with the procedure_body_site_code

required: Provide code in Compact URI (CURIE) pattern.  NCIt URL: https://ncit.nci.nih.gov/ncitbrowser/ConceptReport.jsp?dictionary=NCI_Thesaurus&code=C<code>  SNOMED-CT URL: http://snomed.info/id/<code>  UMLS URL: https://uts.nlm.nih.gov/uts/umls/concept/<code> CCI URL: https://www.cihi.ca/en/cci-coding-structure

fields.name: procedure_code
fields.description: Use code from NCIt, SNOMED-CT, UMLS or CCI to represent the procedure performed.

fields.name: procedure_term
fields.description: Provide the standardized and human readable term derived from the coding system associated with the procedure_code

schemas.name: specimen
schemas.description: Any material sample taken from a biological entity, living or dead, from physical object or the environment

fields.name: submitter_specimen_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the specimen within the study, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant within the study, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: age_at_specimen_collection
fields.description: Indicate participant's age( in days) when specimen was collected.

required: Refer to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3) manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

fields.name: specimen_anatomic_location_code
fields.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected. Please use C80.9 if the primary site of a specimen is Unkown.

fields.name: specimen_anatomic_location_term
fields.description: Provide the standardized and human readable term derived from the coding system associated with the specimen anatomic location code.

fields.name: specimen_laterality
fields.description: For cancer in a paired organ, indicate the side on which the specimen was obtained.

fields.name: specimen_processing
fields.description: Indicate the technique used to process specimen.

codeList: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen

fields.name: specimen_storage
fields.description: Indicate the method of long term storage for specimen that were not extracted freshly or immediately cultured.

fields.name: specimen_tissue_source_code
fields.description: Indicate the tissue source of the specimen from which a biopsy or other tissue specimen was obtained.  Use codes from NCIt (NCI Thesaurus) or SNOMED-CT (SNOMED Clinical Terms) in Compact URI (CURIE) pattern.

fields.name: specimen_tissue_source_term
fields.description: Indicate the human readable label for the specimen tissue source code.

schemas.name: treatment
schemas.description: Medications, procedures, other actions taken for clinical management

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the treatment, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_diagnosis_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the primary diagnosis event, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_participant_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the participant within the study, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: age_at_treatment
fields.description: Age (in days) of the participant at the time the treatment was administered.

fields.name: treatment_duration
fields.description: The length of time (in days) over which the treatment was administered.

fields.name: treatment_intent
fields.description: The purpose of the treatment or the desired effect or outcome resulting from the treatment.

fields.name: treatment_response
fields.description: The outcome of the treatment, indicating how the patient responded to the intervention

fields.name: treatment_status
fields.description: Indicate the donor's status of the prescribed treatment.

codeList: Treatment incomplete due to technical or organizational problems
Treatment stopped due to acute toxicity
Treatment stopped due to lack of efficacy (disease progression)

fields.name: treatment_type
fields.description: The category or method of treatment administered

fields.name: image_hosted_url
fields.description: A URL for where the image is hosted

fields.name: image_hosted_format
fields.description: Accepted data types for images

fields.name: image_processing_pipeline
fields.description:
Post processing pipeline dependent on image_hosted_format where:
 - image_hosted_format is PNG, choices are 
* PipelineA
* PipelineB
* PipelineC
 - image_hosted_format is SVG, choices are 
* PipelineA
* PipelineD
* PipelineE
 - image_hosted_format is PDF or JPEG, choices are 
* PipelineA
* PipelineD
* PipelineF

fields.name: image_processing_personel
fields.description:
String value for the person who processed the image.
Must be provided.If not 'image_processing_null_reason' must be provided

fields.name: image_processing_null_reason
fields.description:
Tracks reason for why image processing personnel was not provided.
Only applicable if image_processing_personnel is not provided.
Possible values:
* Unknown
* Revoked
* Not Provided
Otherwise leave empty
